alert.note: Alert for Northern Humboldt Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 2:24PM PST until January 04 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 1 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...High astronomical tides coupled with strong southerly winds and large surf will cause minor flooding in low-lying areas along Humboldt Bay. High tide is predicted to be around 8.4 feet at North Spit tidal gauge around 12 PM Tuesday afternoon. Minor flooding is possible whenever tide levels reach 8.8 feet or more. * WHERE...Northern Humboldt Coast County. * WHEN...From 11 AM to 1 PM PST Tuesday.. . * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected.
info.instruction: A Coastal Flood Advisory indicates that onshore winds and tides will combine to generate flooding of low areas along the shore. Feet Above Ground is locally defined as feet above the Highest Astronomical Tide or HAT.
